section.title: Introduction
section.p: The corpus is situated on the machine victorio.uit.no. The main directories in the corpus are orig, bound and free. orig contains the original files with the original names (bar spaces replaced with _) and in the original format. bound and free have the same structure as orig, but contains the files converted from the original format to our internal xml-format (add link to document describing it). We use a script called convert2xml.pl (link to that one too) to do the conversion.
Inside these directories are directories for various languages. They contain parallell translations to the sami documents. Below is an outline of the directory structure.
section.source: /usr/local/share/corp/ orig/ eng/ fin/ nob/ sma/ sme/ smj/ swe/ gt/ eng/ fin/ nob/ sma/ sme/ smj/ swe/
section.p: Inside each of the language directories the structure outlined below is used.
section.source: admin/ depts/ guovda/ karas/ others/ sd/ bible/ ot/ nt/ facta/ ficti/ laws/ news/ Assu MinAigi NRK YLE other

section.title: Meta data
section.p: When converting the original documents, meta data are extracted and inserted into the resulting xml-document. Corrections and additions are done by editing an xsl file with same basename as the original document. This file is made by copying the file gt/script/XSL-template.xsl
The lines that add or change meta data are outlined below.
section.source:
<!-- Add title/author info/publisher info manually if different from AntiWord output: --> <xsl:variable name="title" select="''"/> <xsl:variable name="author" select="''"/> <xsl:variable name="author-gender" select="'f'"/> <xsl:variable name="author2" select="''"/> <xsl:variable name="author-gender2" select="'f'"/> <xsl:variable name="author3" select="''"/> <xsl:variable name="author-gender3" select="'f'"/> <xsl:variable name="author4" select="''"/> <xsl:variable name="author-gender4" select="'f'"/> <xsl:variable name="publisher" select="''"/> <xsl:variable name="translated-from" select="''"/> <xsl:variable name="year" select="''"/> <xsl:variable name="ISBN" select="''"/> <xsl:variable name="ISSN" select="''"/> <xsl:variable name="genre" select="''"/>
<xsl:variable name="mainlang" select="'sme'"/>
section.p: We also have a detailed description on how the the conversion from many document formats to our internal xml format is done.
